AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Raul Rafael Arce-Jasso: defendant, appellant, and defendant-appellee in a case involving possession of cocaine with intent to distribute, driver of the Mercury Cougar, pleaded not guilty, filed motion for reconsideration, contends that the Court does not have appellate jurisdiction to review the district court's decision to suppress the cocaine, made a motion for judgment of acquittal, argued about the materiality of evidence suppression to his ultimate criminal fate, contends that appeals from judgments of acquittal are not permitted, argues that the law of the case doctrine precludes the Government from presenting an adequate case, defendant in a case where the appeal is dismissed due to being moot, owner of a freshly cleaned car
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jesus Garcia: border patrol agent manning the primary inspection lane at the border patrol checkpoint, questioned Arce-Jasso about his citizenship, stated questions about common destinations for illegal aliens
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States of America: plaintiff-appellant seeking review of the district court's judgment of acquittal and denial of motion for reconsideration, filed joint notice of appeal, has the ability to appeal suppression of evidence in criminal cases under certain conditions, prosecutor in a case where the Court has customarily treated the filing of an untimely notice of appeal within the 30-day additional period as a motion for a determination whether excusable neglect or good cause entitles the defendant to an extension of time to appeal, argued that its untimeliness should be excused, appellant in a dismissed case due to lack of effective remedy on remand
